revised_title: The Belluga Stone: Observations and Uses
tldr: The Belluga Stone, also known as Lapis Bellugae, is a unique natural stone found in the fish called Belluga or the white fish. The author, Peter Collinson, describes its shape, size, texture, and the different parts of the fish where it can be found. The stone is said to have medicinal properties, being used to promote delivery, as a diuretic, and as a lithontriptic. It is found in rivers around Astracan, the Volga, Don, Baltic, and Caspian Seas.
